title: Updates for Norfolk on Wednesday, 2 December 2015 - BBC News
summary: plans to build 400 homes in wymondham are rejected by councillors for a fourth time .
a school in hoveton is opening its own ice rink to teach pupils how to skate .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: the team will be back tomorrow from 08:00 .
do n't forget you can get in touch with news or via email , twitter or facebook .
have a good evening .

documents.title: weather : cloudy with spots of light rain
text: the weather overnight will be mostly cloudy with any clear intervals filling in from the north and the chance of a few spots of light drizzle possible .
temperatures staying mild at 9c ( 50f ) .
bbc weather has more details .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: linnets ' derby date at cambridge
text: king 's lynn town could move up to sixth in the southern premier tonight if they win at cambridge city .
the linnets recorded their first victory of the season against tonight 's opponents back at the beginning of august .
the game will be played at st ives ' ground , kicking off at 19:45 .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: watch : brian blessed 'a fully-trained cosmonaut '
text: actor brian blessed , 79 , has been telling the bbc how he went to russia to complete his cosmonaut training
he now hopes to travel to the international space station in autumn 2017 .
the actor is best known for his roles in flash gordon and star wars and as the voice of grampy rabbit in the peppa pig series .

documents.title: city council defends cycle pathway after criticism
text: the `` prohibitive costs '' of by-passing tree roots meant a separate cycle path along the avenues in norwich could not be built , norwich city council has claimed .
the council has been responding to claims by norwich cycling campaign that `` advisory '' cycle lanes along the avenues are dangerous .
the authority said the `` paths would have to be dug by hand '' and there was no guarantee tree roots would still not break through from underneath .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: gresham 's school to expand
text: gresham 's school in holt has got planning permission for a new sixth form and music block .
four student halls at the independent boarding school will also be improved and the new building will include an auditorium and cafe which will be available for community use .
work will start in the spring .

documents.title: headlines : thousands of homes approved for thetford two chihuahuas are mauled to death by four dogs
text: the main stories this tea-time :
author: BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: jack the ripper panto 'not for the easily offended '
text: a theatre company has defended its production jack the ripper : the panto following an online petition against it .
jim blyth of spooky kid productions said the show had played to 1,600 people in three previous norwich performances without any complaints .
the theatre accepted the play was not for the `` easily offended '' or to everyone 's taste .

documents.title: 'milestone ' as 5,000 homes and £ 150m investment for thetford are approved
text: thousands of homes and £ 150 million of community investment will be coming to thetford after the approval of a landmark development .
author: Bury Free Press

documents.title: chihuahuas killed in attack by dogs
text: two chihuahua dogs have been killed , and their 80-year-old owner bitten , in an attack by four other dogs .
a man and a woman have been arrested following the savaging in king 's lynn yesterday .
the four staffordshire bull terrier-type dogs , who were off their lead at the time , are being held in kennels and police are appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: mp keith simpson says he will support air strikes in syria
text: the mp for broadland keith simpson has told mps that he will support air strikes on syria .

mr simpson said `` the intelligence and security services can not guarantee to prevent every threat '' and that while there was no easy solution , the prime minister had a plan that should be supported .
for the latest on the commons debate on syria , visit bbc politics .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: petition against jack the ripper pantomime
text: an online petition has been launched against a production at norwich playhouse called jack the ripper : the panto .

the panto , which has played in the city three times in the past six years , is scheduled to run from next weekend but the organiser of the protest - who has n't seen the production - says it 's inappropriate to make jokes about violence against women .
it 's almost mocking victims back then and victims now as well . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: new road layout 'dangerous ' says cycle campaign group
text: norwich cycling campaign claims the city council 's decision to paint on `` advisory '' cycle lanes on the avenues and not to widen the road for separate lanes is dangerous .
it has made a video which shows what it 's like to cycle and drive along the new road layout between colman road and bluebell road .
norwich city council has been asked to comment .
author: Louise Holmes
BBC Norfolk

documents.title: norwich one of six cities to host sports relief games
text: norwich has been chosen to hold running , cycling and swimming events for sports relief next year .
the sport relief games will be held at the university of east anglia in march .
norwich is one of just six cities across the uk to have been chosen hold a flagship event for the charity .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: watch : pupils skate at primary school 's own ice rink
text: a primary school in hoveton is hoping a synthetic ice rink set up in the playground will help it raise some cash and allow local children to learn to skate .
one of the pupils at st john 's community primary designed a special website allowing people to book tickets .
the 12m x 8m ( 40ft x 26ft ) rink has been hired for a week .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: plans for homes in wymondham rejected for fourth time
text: a plan to build homes on wymondham rugby club has been turned down unanimously by councillors .
the club wanted to build 90 homes at its tuttles lane ground , after moving to a new site less than a mile away , and other developers wanted to put 300 homes at the nearby norwich common .
plans have previously been rejected three times .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: weather : bright and breezy
text: the day should remain sunny with blue skies although it will be breezy as well .
some cloud will move in but temperatures staying mild at 12c ( 53f ) .
weather has more details .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: watch : repairs to glass lift at great yarmouth town hall
text: repairs are being carried out on the lift at great yarmouth town hall four months after a glass panel shattered .
an investigation found an `` inherent impurity '' in the glass lift shaft caused it to break without warning .
all four panels are being replaced and the work is being claimed for on insurance , so it wo n't cost taxpayers .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: 'pukefest ' warning against king 's lynn hotel development
text: developers are being urged not to turn a prominent nightspot in king 's lynn into what a councillor is calling `` a pukefest . ''
proposals to keep the pub at the wenns hotel in saturday market place were approved by west norfolk council .
but councillor mike tilbury is now calling for the redevelopment of the site to benefit the whole area .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: city 's new wave out to impress
text: the back page of the norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: headlines : controversial plans for homes turned down for fourth time developers urged not to turn king 's lynn nightspot into `` a pukefest ''
text: the main stories this lunchtime :
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: arthritic penguin heads to norfolk
text: we told you yesterday about an arthritic penguin who 's having his special needs catered for when he moves to a new home in norfolk .
you can read more here about dippy , the senior bird in his colony , who along with 10 other penguins , will be rehomed at great yarmouth sea life centre .

documents.title: watch : what bombing of is targets in syria would mean for raf marham
text: mps will vote later on whether to bomb is targets in syria .
here 's what a vote in favour of bombing could mean for raf marham , where two tornado jets are on standby .
author: Alex Dunlop
BBC Look East

documents.title: it 's not about me , insists city boss
text: the back page of the eastern daily press :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: your street needs you : volunteers sought to champion community spirit
text: here is the front page of the norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: man charged over antiques thefts
text: a man from lowestoft is due to appear before magistrates charged in connection with the theft of antiques worth over £ 100,000 .
barry spearing , 55 , from green drive , was arrested yesterday on sus of theft and money laundering .
officers also arrested a 50-year-old woman from ipswich , on sus of money laundering and handling stolen goods .
she was bailed until march .
barry spearing was acquitted of theft on 22 july 2016 at norwich crown court .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: dealer denies weapons charges
text: here is the front page of today 's eastern daily press :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: norwich market traders call for more public and council support
text: traders on norwich market say they need more support from shoppers and the city council .
it comes as the authority draws up a 10-year plan for its future .
traders say better signage and more advertising could help promote the market .
author: Rob Sykes
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: school hires ice rink to teach pupils how to skate
text: a school in norfolk is opening its own ice rink today .
pupils at st john 's primary school in hoveton will use it to learn to skate , and it 'll be opened up to the wider community at a charge .
the synthetic ice rink is part of the school 's winter wonderland event .

documents.title: norfolk mps prepare to vote on syria bombing
text: a 10-hour debate takes part in parliament today after which mps will vote on whether to back the prime minister 's motion to bomb so-called islamic state militants in syria .
here 's how norfolk mps stand at the moment :
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: rugby club appeals again to build homes on land in wymondham
text: a plan to build homes on wymondham rugby club land is being recommended to be turned down again today .
the club and other developers want to build almost 400 new homes on land around wymondham .
plans have been rejected three times before and a report for south norfolk councillors recommends they refuse them again .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: weather : feeling dry , mild and cloudy
text: another very mild day with a lot of cloud but the odd bright spell .
a light south-westerly breeze and a top temperature of 12c ( 53f ) .
weather has your local forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: headlines : developers appeal over rugby club homes plan primary school opens own ice rink

author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: hello and welcome to norfolk live for wednesday
text: the team will be bringing you all the latest news , sport , travel , and weather thoughout the day .
keep us up to date with your norfolk news via email , twitter and facebook .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live
